A **javelin** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), and like all spears gains +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") against [kebabable](/wiki/Kebabable "Kebabable") monsters. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **throwing spear** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

## Generation

Javelins make up about 1.0% of randomly generated weapons on the ground, as [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"), and in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") - they can be stocked in general stores and weapons shops.

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄116 chance of generating with a javelin as their weapon before role-based replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

The javelin is a somewhat more rare form of spear - it is somewhat lighter and weaker than the standard spear, dealing the same damage to small monsters but doing slightly less damage against large monsters. It is generally not considered as an option, unless found early in the game by a character capable of training the skill - even then, a javelin will be more than likely replaced by the mid-game.

## History

The javelin first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d"). From this version to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), including variants based on these versions, there is a separate **javelin** skill that only the javelin uses:

| Javelin |                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max     | Role                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Basic   | - [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"), [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") |
| Skilled | * [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman"), [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest")                                                                                                       |
| Expert  | - [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")                                                                                                                                                                            |

This is meant to reflect the intended use of spears for thrusting attacks in melee, compared to the javelin's use as a ranged weapon. In [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), the javelin skill is merged into the spear skill.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Javelin](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Javelin "wikipedia:Special:Search/Javelin")***

A javelin is a light spear designed primarily for throwing as a ranged weapon. The word comes from Middle English and is derived from Old French *javelin*, a diminutive of *javelot* ("spear"). A warrior or soldier armed primarily with one or more javelins is a "javelineer". A javelin is nearly always thrown by hand, although there are launchers designed to increase the distance of thrown javelins, such as spear-throwers or the amentum.

The javelin is often associated with classical Greece and ancient Rome and is used by several other cultures throughout various periods of human history, with archaeological evidence that javelins and throwing sticks were already in use around the end of the Lower Paleolithic era. The most recent use of javelins as a weapon in the modern era is as the primary choice of warriors of the Zulu nation in southern Africa. The modern javelin is also predominantly used for sporting purposes, naturally including the [javelin throw](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/javelin_throw "wikipedia:javelin throw").

## Variants

Some variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 may retain the spear skill, while other variants based on later versions typically do not.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") retains the javelin skill as separate from the spear skill. This also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") merges the javelin skill into the spear skill. The javelin deals 1d8 damage to all monsters, and can be poisoned, and the [atlatl](/index.php?title=Atlatl_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Atlatl (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") serves as a [launcher](/wiki/Launcher "Launcher") for javelins and other spears.

[Amhimitl](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Amhimitl "DNetHack artifacts") is a neutral [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") javelin made of [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone") that acts as the [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift for [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"). It has +1d5 to-hit and deals +1d8 [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage against monsters without [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), along with +3d4 holy or unholy damage when blessed or cursed respectively. Amhimitl returns to your quiver when fired and can be [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot"), which causes it to be thrown immediately after returning multiple times in quick succession - the artifact does not return if it misfires, and any multishot is aborted if this occurs.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a javelin can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining 2 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt") and a spear.

A javelin can be combined with a [glaive](/wiki/Glaive "Glaive") to create a [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance").

## Encyclopedia entry

\- they come together with great random, and a spear is brast,  
and one party brake his shield and the other one goes down,  
horse and man, over his horse-tail and brake his neck, and  
then the next candidate comes randoming in, and brast his  
spear, and the other man brast his shield, and down he goes,  
horse and man, over his horse-tail, and brake his neck, and  
then there's another elected, and another and another and  
still another, till the material is all used up; and when you  
come to figure up results, you can't tell one fight from  
another, nor who whipped; and as a picture of living, raging,  
roaring battle, sho! why it's pale and noiseless - just  
ghosts scuffling in a fog. Dear me, what would this barren  
vocabulary get out of the mightiest spectacle? - the burning  
of Rome in Nero's time, for instance? Why, it would merely  
say 'Town burned down; no insurance; boy brast a window,  
fireman brake his neck!' Why, that ain't a picture!

\[ A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court, by Mark  
  Twain ]
